moduleGoal: Organize data effectively using Python's core sequence types.

theory: Can a list contain different data types?
What is the difference between append() and extend()?
What happens if you remove an element that doesn't exist?
How do you empty a list?
practical: Create a shopping list with 5 items.
Pop the last item and print it.

theory: Does sort() modify the original list?
How do you check if 'Apple' is in a list?
What is the difference between list1 = list2 and list1 = list2.copy()?
How do you sort a list in descending order?
What is the syntax for slicing lists?
practical: Create a list of numbers [5, 1, 8, 3]. Sort it.
Check if 10 is in your list.
Create a copy of your list and modify the copy. Check the original.
Get the first 3 items using slicing.

topics: When to use Tuples vs Lists

theory: Can you add an item to a tuple?
Why are tuples faster than lists?
How do you define a tuple with one item?
Can a tuple contain a mutable list?
practical: Create a tuple of coordinates (x, y).
Try to change the first value and observe the error.
Unpack a tuple of (Name, Age) into two variables.
Convert a list of user IDs to a tuple.
Create a list inside a tuple and modify the list.

moduleProject.title: To-Do List Manager (CLI)
moduleProject.description: Build a command-line app to manage tasks. Store tasks in a List. Allow adding, removing (by index or name), and viewing tasks.
steps: Loop a menu: Add, Remove, View, Exit.
Remove: Show list with index, use `tasks.pop(index)`.
View: Iterate and print with numbering (enumerate).
